question: Who are the Métis?
possible_answers: A. The distinct Aboriginal people of Atlantic Canada
B. A people of mixed Inuit or First Nations ancestry, most of whom live on the Prairies
C. First Nations people speaking the Michif dialect
D. A distinct people of mixed Aboriginal and European ancestry
answer: D. A distinct people of mixed Aboriginal and European ancestry
explanatory_sentence: The Métis are a distinct people of mixed Aboriginal and European ancestry, the majority of whom live in the Prairie provinces. They come from both French- and English-speaking backgrounds and speak their own dialect, Michif.
